title: Long before coveting Greenland, the US expanded by opening its checkbook
subhead: From the early 19th century on, the United States expanded by acquiring territory through purchase or force. By expressing interest in Greenland, Donald Trump has revived that tradition.

title: Marine Le Pen's political future is at stake as her appeal trial opens
Trump warns of 'very strong action' if Iran follows through with threats of hanging protestors
Javier Milei's budget cuts criticized after Patagonia fires
subhead: In just eight days, nearly 15,000 hectares have been destroyed by flames, including 12,000 in Chubut Province. Environmental advocacy groups have condemned drastic budget cuts to the Federal Fire Management System.

title: US prices remain high, despite Trump's claims of stable inflation
subhead: December figures show that consumer prices rose by 2.7% over 12 months, the same as in November. However, food and energy inflation (excluding gasoline) – the most sensitive costs for Americans – remain elevated.

title: Paris launches project for Montparnasse renovation
subhead: The architect Renzo Piano unveiled his new renovation plan for the shopping center. Construction is hoped to start in 2028.

title: Iran internet blackout: 'The authorities have managed to control the almost sole way out'
subhead: Iran's near-total disconnection from the internet can be explained by a strategy of closely controlling the only gateway for data to enter and leave the country, which the Iranian authorities have pursued for several years.

title: US Supreme Court seems poised to uphold transgender athlete bans
When the US and Venezuela were 'best friends': A four-minute history
US labels Muslim Brotherhood groups in Egypt, Lebanon and Jordan terrorist organizations
Clintons refuse to testify in US House Epstein investigation as Republicans threaten contempt proceedings
Corsican nationalist's assassination spotlights criminals' grip on island
Being gay in Uganda, where the death penalty looms
Iranian regime rallies supporters in bid to quell unrest
Farmers roll hundreds of tractors into Paris in fresh protests
Centre Pompidou cedes temporary space at Paris's Grand Palais
Hearings open in ICJ Rohingya genocide case against Myanmar
Moroccan King Mohammed VI's quiet absence from AFCON
Understanding Marine Le Pen's crucial appeal trial
Marine Le Pen returns to court for appeal of graft conviction
subhead: The French far right's leader, sentenced in 2025 to four years in prison and a five-year ban on holding an elected office after being convicted of embezzlement of pubic funds, goes back to court with 11 co-defendants for a one-month trial starting Tuesday.

title: 'The Islamic Republic of Iran is entering its final phase'
subhead: Hemmed in by domestic and external crises, the Islamic Republic of Iran is now finding itself with nowhere left to turn, analyzes Farid Vahid, the co-director of the Observatory of North Africa and the Middle East at the Fondation Jean Jaurès.

title: How France's fixation with decline serves the Trumpian narrative
subhead: As the threat posed by the United States grows, narratives of decline have gained traction in France, setting the stage for a presidential campaign centered on the power of France and Europe.

title: France's population decline presents a political challenge
'The trial of Marine Le Pen exposes the fragility of the concept of the rule of law'
'For her appeals trial, Marine Le Pen has made the shrewd choice to fight differently'
